content: errata errata heel flap on an odd no if stitches row 1 ws sl 1 p-wise p to end row 2 rs sl 1 p-wise #sl 1 k1 repeat from # to end repeat the above 2 row until the heel flap is 23 23 25 27 27 row in length from start of slipped stitch heel pattern ending on a ws row so on row 2 the rs there are 2 slipped sts at beg of row 2 so you end on a k stitch the slipped sts at the beg of row fold under to form a neat selvedge and aren t part of the central knitting so you can t really see them then when you pick up around the edges of a heel flap you re picking up along that edge so it hides edge sts even more leaving a ribbed effect on the centre of the heel flap this contains the pdf anatomy of a sock diagram and glossary of some basic terms to help newbies understand sock construction the design was donated to médecins sans frontières as part of the p/hop project it is not available from that source now but i have added it to my ravelry store for free and hope this inspires you to donate to msf my local dog charity retired greyhound charity whittingham kennels 1 which is where i send 100% of my pattern revenue or another charity of your choice this sock is easy enough for a beginner to tackle and you can download an information sheet on the anatomy of a sock from the same page as the pattern p/hop is pennies per hour of pleasure so please feel free to use this pattern
